questions.question: In network security terminology, what role does Trudy typically play?
What can Trudy do as a network attacker?
options: Eavesdrop, insert messages, impersonate, hijack connections, and cause denial of service
questions.answer: Eavesdrop, insert messages, impersonate, hijack connections, and cause denial of service

questions.question: What does SSL/TLS provide for secure web communication?
options: Only encryption of data in transit
Encryption, authentication, and data integrity for web transactions
questions.answer: Encryption, authentication, and data integrity for web transactions

questions.question: What does a firewall primarily do?
options: Monitors and controls incoming/outgoing network traffic based on security rules
Only authenticates users by their IP address
Prevents viruses from infecting individual computers
questions.answer: Monitors and controls incoming/outgoing network traffic based on security rules

questions.question: What is the main difference between SSL and its successor TLS?
options: SSL is for email, TLS is for web browsing
TLS is more secure with improved cryptographic protocols
SSL uses public-key crypto, TLS uses only symmetric crypto
There is no difference; they are the same protocol
questions.answer: TLS is more secure with improved cryptographic protocols

questions.question: Which protocol suite provides security at the IP layer for VPNs?
What does a DMZ (Demilitarized Zone) accomplish in network architecture?
options: It encrypts all internal network traffic
It places public-facing servers in a separate, isolated network segment
It prevents all inbound internet traffic
It replaces the need for a firewall
questions.answer: It places public-facing servers in a separate, isolated network segment

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an Intrusion Detection System (IDS)?
options: To block all malicious traffic automatically
To monitor network traffic for suspicious activity and generate alerts
To encrypt sensitive data at rest
To authenticate all users before network access
questions.answer: To monitor network traffic for suspicious activity and generate alerts

questions.question: Which network attack involves flooding a target with excessive requests to disrupt service?
What security protocol is commonly used for secure remote command-line access?
What type of firewall keeps track of network connections and allows return traffic for established sessions?
What does VPN stand for and what is its primary purpose?
options: Virtual Private Network - to create a secure, encrypted tunnel over a public network
Verified Packet Network - to verify all network packets
Virtual Protocol Number - to assign protocol numbers
Very Private Network - to hide network existence
questions.answer: Virtual Private Network - to create a secure, encrypted tunnel over a public network

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a typical component of a cipher suite in TLS?
What network attack redirects traffic by corrupting the ARP table of a device on the LAN?
What is the main advantage of using a proxy firewall?
options: It is the fastest type of firewall
It terminates connections and inspects application-layer traffic
It works only at the physical layer
questions.answer: It terminates connections and inspects application-layer traffic
